Description: Neck, shoulder, and lip fragment of North Ionian pottery vessel, perhaps a krater; inside streakily glazed. Lip, lightly ridged, glazed black; on neck, looped chain, a black dot with a red centre in each loop. The shoulder glazed black with incised compass-drawn scales, a white(?) dot in the centre.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Venit: 'The compass-drawn scales incised on the dark ground and the looped chain can be paralleled on a bowl from Naukratis (Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA 62; see Alexandria 17174).'
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 20, no. 64 pl. 18)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.921)
